definitions.definition: A person who seeks to be elected or appointed to a position or privilege .
examples: Smith announced he was the party's candidate for the next election.
All candidates who miss the deadline or make a spelling mistake in their applications are automatically rejected.

definitions.definition: A person who is thought likely or worthy to gain a position or privilege .

examples: Candidates must remain silent for the entirety of the exam.

definitions.definition: Someone or something likely or suited to undergo or be chosen for a purpose.
examples: After being presented with various suitors, she decided none of the candidates were the kind of man she was looking for.

definitions.definition: A gene which may play a role in a given disease .

main_definition: A person who seeks to be elected or appointed to a position or privilege .
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) A person who is thought likely or worthy to gain a position or privilege . [from 1760s]
( originally jargon ) A participant in an examination . [from 1690s]
Someone or something likely or suited to undergo or be chosen for a purpose.
( genetics ) A gene which may play a role in a given disease .
